(note that $K \leq G$ is the maximal compact subgroup of $G$, hence its complexification $K_{{\mathbb{{C}}}}$ is isomorphic to $G$). In the following work, we will call $X_{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ as the \textbf{quantization} of ${\mathcal{{O}}}$.\\
\indent As hinted in \cite{V1}, one needs to take special attention when the orbit closure $\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ is not normal. One reason is due to the algbero-geometric fact that $R(\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}}) \cong R({\mathcal{{O}}})$ if and only if  $\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ is normal. Following the spirit of the orbit method, one needs to give a quantization model for $\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ separately when $\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ is not normal.\\
\indent Here is a summary on the current progress of the above quantization scheme. In \cite{B 2008}, Barbasch constructs such model for a large class of classical nilpotent orbits. Using a completely different method in \cite{Br 2003}, Ranee Brylinski constructs a Dixmier algebra for all classical nilpotent orbit closures. The reconciliation between the two models is the main theme of the Ph.D. thesis of the author \cite{W2}.\\ 
\indent Contrary to the classical setting, very little is known about the scheme for exceptional groups. We now focus on the case for $G = G_2$. Write $\{\alpha, \beta \}$ be the simple roots of ${\mathfrak{{g}}}$, with $\alpha$ being the short root. The fundamental weights of ${\mathfrak{{g}}}$ is therefore given by

\indent For each ${\mathcal{{O}}}' \in S_{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$, Lusztig assigned a Levi subgroup $H({\mathcal{{O}}}',{\mathcal{{O}}}) \leq \overline{A}({\mathcal{{O}}})$. For example, the largest orbit in the special piece ${\mathcal{{O}}} \in S_{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ has $H({\mathcal{{O}}},{\mathcal{{O}}}) = 1$, and the smallest orbit ${\mathcal{{O}}}'' \in S_{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ has $H({\mathcal{{O}}}'',{\mathcal{{O}}}) = \overline{A}({\mathcal{{O}}})$.\\
\indent By the conjecture of Sommers, if ${\mathcal{{O}}}$ has $\overline{A}({\mathcal{{O}}}) = S_3, S_4$ or $S_5$, then all ${\mathcal{{O}}}' \in S_{{\mathcal{{O}}}}$ with $H({\mathcal{{O}}}',{\mathcal{{O}}})$ not equal to $1$ or $\overline{A}({\mathcal{{O}}})$ (that is, not equal to ${\mathcal{{O}}}$ or ${\mathcal{{O}}}''$) have non-normal closures.\\ 
\indent For example, in the case of $G_2$ we studied above, we have ${\mathcal{{O}}}_8 \in S_{{\mathcal{{O}}}_{10}}$ and $H({\mathcal{{O}}}_8,{\mathcal{{O}}}_{10}) = S_2 \leq S_3 = \overline{A}({\mathcal{{O}}}_{10})$. So $\overline{{\mathcal{{O}}}_8}$ is conjectured to have non-normal closure, which has been shown to be true.\\
